frameDefinitions: A Proprietor owns or runs a Business which provides a Product (which may be goods or services).
A Member is semi-permanently part of a socially constructed Group.
A Communicator speaks to an Addressee in such a way that the Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the Message.   '
A Co_participant fills the same role as the Participant in an event or relation. ''
A group of Arguers (also expressible as Arguer1 and Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an Issue.
This frame contains words that describe a set of individuals which possess some Commonality, generally a common attribute.
frameExamples: The consumer electronics <t>company</t> Apple has exploded with popularity in recent years.
Victor is <t>part</t> of the Red Crescent
Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively <t>conveys</t> some of South Africa 's problems .INI
The mayor was killed <t>along</t> <t>with</t> three bodyguards and his driver.
We <t>bickered</t> about semantics for an hour.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Business</fen> identifies the company or establishment. This may be the target itself or the <fen>Business_Name</fen> if it is an appositive not set off with commas (i.e. restrictive):
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> in which the business is located.
The person who belongs to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
The time at which the <fen>Member</fen> is a member of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The location where the membership relationship holds.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives a <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
In this frame, <fen>Participant</fen> is the accompanied entity (person or object).
In this frame, <fen>Co-participant</fen> is the accompanying entity (person or object).
Two or more entities construed as symmetrically and usually equally participating in an event or relation.
A group of people in an argument.
A person who is arguing with Arguer2.
The person who is being argued with by <fen>Arguer1</fen>.
The the thing the the <fen>Arguers</fen> are arguing over or about.
The time when the argument takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Arguers</fen> quarrel

This role denotes the people in possession of the Commonality. This role is usually genetive, the object of a postnominal PP, or null instantiated (INI), and null instantiaton often implies the public at large, as in 'the common good'.
This role denotes an object or attribute which is jointly posessed by the <fen>Entities</fen>.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
listRoleExamples: Two <fex>members</fex> of the Red Cross were here about a donation
<fex>Nobody</fex> seems to be able to get the idea through to her that she needs a job!!!!

According to Masztalics, a good teacher uses experiments to get the point across
<fex>to the class</fex>.
He tried to get through to his wife <fex>that the debt he's taken on buying stocks poses no risk</fex>.
<fex>The article</fex> conveys Mr. Handley's disrespect for those who disagree with him.
Greenspan got his point across <fex>yesterday</fex> that a measured pace of rate hikes is still the plan.
<fex>Lao Tzu and Confucious</fex> built the house together.
Their shared <fex>parents</fex> were their only similarity.
